products.title: Success Kid
products.description: Success kid (also known as "I hate sandcastles") became popular in around 2008 when a photo of a smug baby at the beach was used across the web on social media, mainly as personal profile photographs.

products.title: Disaster Girl
products.description: In 2004, a photograph of a young girl with a devilish smile in front of a burning house appeared online. It was picked up four years later by Buzzfeed and soon got the attention of the internet with posts and re-posts all across the web.

products.title: Doge
products.description: Originating in the depths of 2010, this meme came to life thanks to some glorious photos of Shiba Inus - a breed of tiny and agile Japanese dog with a quizzical face. Posted on a personal blog, the original photos appeared with one such dog named "Kabosu" casually lounging on a sofa with a sideways glance at the camera.

products.title: The Art Of The Deal
products.price: a small loan of 1 million dollars
products.description: US President Donald Trump has been the subject of many a meme in the run up to and well into his Presidency.

products.title: Facepalm
products.description: The classic facepalm is a well-known symbol for dismay at someone's foolish actions â€“ especially where a lapse in judgement or common sense might apply.

products.title: Nokia 3310
products.description: The classic Nokia 3310 mobile phone has developed somewhat of a legendary status over the years. Originally released in 2000, this phone was a brute of a device; hard-wearing and long-lasting compared to today's fragile phones.
